page.title: 02FARMING IN CAMBER
page.content: At one time the whole Marsh was sheep farming, but over the last 20 years cereal crops have been introduced. However the Romney Marsh sheep remain supreme in this area. The permanent pastures will carry two to three sheep to the acre even in the hardest winter, and in the summer 7 ewes and theirlambs. One of the first things people notice when coming to this part of the country is the number and the density of the sheep.People stayig at the holiday camps are delighted to see and hear the lambs. The rams cover the ewes in November, lambing starts at the beginning of April, nearly all ewes being lambed outside in the fields. Shearing starts at the beginning of June and often continues till the end of July. The Romny Fleeceis a high quality long wool a good ram will shear up to 20lbs.
